ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Were you very anxious, frightened, horrified, or helpless during your traumatic event (please choose yes if you felt any of these emotions during your traumatic event)?
How frightened were you that you were going to lose your life?
Notes: 1= Not at all ; 2= A little bit ; 3= Moderately ; 4=  Quite a bit; 5= Extremely

ElementDescription: How frightened were you that you were going to lose part of your body
Notes: 1= Not at all ; 2= A little bit ; 3= Moderately ; 4=  Quite a bit; 5= Extremely

ElementDescription: How frightened were you that you were going to be severely injured?
Notes: 1= Not at all ; 2= A little bit ; 3= Moderately ; 4=  Quite a bit; 5= Extremely

ElementDescription: How severe would you say your injury is?
